snippet: Michael Novogratz, the outspoken trader who ran the $1.6 billion fund, is also said to be leaving after it lost more than 17 percent this year.
abstract: Fortress Investment Group will shut down its $1.6 billion flagship hedge fund in wake of big losses and investor withdrawals.
lead_paragraph: Michael Novogratz, the outspoken trader who ran the $1.6 billion fund, is also said to be leaving after it lost more than 17 percent this year.

headline.print_headline: Fortress Investment’s Flagship Fund Is Said to Be Closing
headline.main: Fortress Said to Plan Wind Down of Flagship Hedge Fund
